### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#27788](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/27788) (rpc: Be able to access RPC parameters by name by achow101)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.

body: Why do we need this repeated test? At the very least it seems orthogonal to the PR?

body: I did it to ensure it is fetching data for old blocks correctly.

body:
Yeah I get that, but I don't see why we wouldn't just run the hash-specified test immediately on the older hash to avoid doing this twice? Also just querying the previous hash seems more efficient than running generate?

Upon further thought, I think it does indeed make sense to include it in this PR.

```diff
diff --git a/test/functional/interface_rest.py b/test/functional/interface_rest.py
index 559249101..1ba8f60d9 100755
--- a/test/functional/interface_rest.py
+++ b/test/functional/interface_rest.py
@@ -420,11 +420,10 @@ class RESTTest (BitcoinTestFramework):
 
         deployment_info = self.nodes[0].getdeploymentinfo()
         assert_equal(deployment_info, self.test_rest_request('/deploymentinfo'))
-        assert_equal(deployment_info, self.test_rest_request(f"/deploymentinfo/{bb_hash}"))
 
-        self.generate(self.wallet, 10, sync_fun=self.no_op)
-        deployment_info = self.nodes[0].getdeploymentinfo(bb_hash)
-        assert_equal(deployment_info, self.test_rest_request(f"/deploymentinfo/{bb_hash}"))
+        previous_bb_hash = self.nodes[0].getblockhash(self.nodes[0].getblockcount() - 1)
+        deployment_info = self.nodes[0].getdeploymentinfo(previous_bb_hash)
+        assert_equal(deployment_info, self.test_rest_request(f"/deploymentinfo/{previous_bb_hash}"))
 
         non_existing_blockhash = '42759cde25462784395a337460bde75f58e73d3f08bd31fdc3507cbac856a2c4'
         resp = self.test_rest_request(f'/deploymentinfo/{non_existing_blockhash}', ret_type=RetType.OBJ, status=400)

```

> Also just querying the previous hash seems more efficient than running generate?

For sure, and for what we'd like to test may be enough, I'm gonna change it.
